interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Who is Killing the Great Chefs of Europe?
Review Date: 2019/07/05
Store: Ted Kotcheff  (Director),     George Segal  (Actor),     Jacqueline Bisset  (Actor)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Warner Home Video, All Titles
Product Description: ["George Segal, Jacqueline Bisset and Robert Morley top the bill of fare in this food- and fun-filled mystery garnished with wit. Segal plays a glib fast-food tycoon and Bisset is his ex-wife, a pastry chef who may become the last course in an enigmatic killer's banquet of death. Morley has a tasty field day as an acerbic gourmet magazine publisher whose cascading series of chins and stomachs bear witness to his love of fine dining. But the mogul's doctors have ordered him to give up his favorite dishes -- and one by one the chefs who create those dishes are slain in the manner of their specialties. Phillipe Noiret, Jean-Pierre Cassel and Jean Rochefort give delicious support, as does a mouth-watering array of wild mushrooms, plump pigeons, shiny artichokes, rich chocolate and more gastronimical delights. Dig in!"]
Average Rating: 4.6

reference_summary:
Hellfighters [DVD]
John Wayne  (Actor),     Katharine Ross  (Actor),     Andrew V. McLaglen  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    G    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, John Wayne Store, All Titles
['Product Description', 'Screen legend John Wayne pays tribute to oil field legend "Red" Adair, as Wayne plays Chance Buckman, a colorful Texan who tames out-of-control infernos in exotic locations around the world. He\'s joined by a crew that includes Jack Lomax (Jay C. Flippen), Joe Horn (Bruce Cabot), and his assistant, Greg Parker (Jim Hutton). Between blazes Chance "carries the torch" for Madelyn, the wife who left him 20 years earlier because of his dangerous lifestyle, and Greg has his hands full at the poker table and in the bedroom with Chance\'s spunky daughter, Tish (Katharine Ross).Directed by action veteran, Andrew V. McLaglen, this film features spectacular special effects and exciting locations in Texas and Wyoming. As the Duke said, "I\'ve made a lot of action movies, but never one as exciting as Hellfighters.', 'Bonus Content:', 'Production Notes', 'Production Notes', 'Cast and Filmmakers', 'Cast and Filmmakers', ']]>', 'Amazon.com', 'Fans of', 'Armageddon', 'might see one or two resemblances between that 1998 box office hit and', 'Hellfighters', ", a 1968 action film by Andrew V. McLaglen, one of John Wayne's favorite directors in his late career. (Their joint ventures included", 'Chisum', ',', 'Cahill: United States Marshal', ', and', 'McLintock!', ") Wayne plays an oil well firefighter in the mold of Red Adair, turning up anywhere in the world where a geyser of fire is shooting up from a once-profitable gusher. His right-hand man (Jim Hutton) has questionable judgment about safety matters and is a scoundrel with the ladies--and neither fact is lost on Wayne when Hutton's character marries his long-lost daughter (Katharine Ross, a mere year after", 'The Graduate', "). The film is an early entry in the disaster-meets-soap-opera genre that flourished in the '70s with such titles as", 'The Towering Inferno', 'and', 'The Poseidon Adventure', '. McClaglen gets a lot of crackle out of his action scenes (many of the firefighting sequences are still startling in their intensity) and turns twin love stories (Hutton and Ross, Wayne and Vera Miles) into frothy studies of adult manners, with equal hints of Howard Hawks and Sidney Sheldon. The widescreen image on DVD offers viewers a chance to see what was then a developing vogue for gratuitous breadth and scope in all its goofy, self-congratulatory glory. (Is it necessary to look at a golf course the way one might look at an African veldt?', 'Hellfighters', 'says yes!) The DVD also includes production notes and written bios on the stars, plus optional French and Spanish subtitles and an optional Spanish soundtrack. The cast and sundry thrills make this film highly enjoyable, and easily forgivable for indulging in such inanities as a subplot concerning--hold on--Venezuelan terrorists! The Duke lives!', '--Tom Keogh']

McLaglen', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Widescreen, Letterboxed', 'Run time': '2 hours and 2 minutes', 'Release date': 'September 2, 2003', 'Actors': 'John Wayne, Katharine Ross, Jim Hutton, Vera Miles, Jay C. Flippen', 'Dubbed': 'French, Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'English, French, Spanish', 'Producers': 'Robert Arthur', 'Studio': 'Universal Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Writers': 'Clair Huffaker', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'}
If you want a break from John Wayne’s usual westerns or War movies but you want some action/adventure (from the 60’s) this is the ticket. Buy it you won’t be disappointed. One of my favorites.
A great movie if you need a break from westerns or war movies

profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Genre Preference:** The user maintains a strong affinity for action and adventure films, particularly from the 1960s and 1970s, while also showing interest in comedies and mystery genres that blend wit and intrigue with engaging storytelling. 

- **Content Interest:** Prefers films that are not only thrilling but also incorporate humor and character-driven narratives, indicating a growing appreciation for light-hearted entertainment alongside traditional action and adventure.

- **Actor Favoritism:** Continues to favor classic Hollywood actors like John Wayne, with the addition of a taste for actors like George Segal and Jacqueline Bisset, suggesting an openness to a broader range of classic cinema.

- **Viewing Context:** Values films as a means to escape typical genres (like westerns or war films) and enjoys varied themes, including comedic mysteries, which adds variety to their viewing experience.

- **Product Format:** Preference for DVDs remains consistent, reflecting a desire for physical media likely driven by collector’s value and nostalgia.

- **Overall Sentiment:** The user retains a positive view of classic films, with a recent review highlighting enjoyment in a humorous film, emphasizing their appreciation for quality filmmaking, character development, and engaging story plots.

With this update, the user profile reflects an evolving taste that embraces both action-adventure and comedic narratives, maintaining a connection to classic cinema.
